<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 384, 392, 399]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 222, 432]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 434, 880, 636]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 664, 212, 678]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 680, 728, 711]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 75.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 75, 94, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 76, 144, 95]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 76, 497, 96]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(z_{1} = r_{1}\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i}\theta_{1}}\) and \(z_{2} = r_{2}\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i}\theta_{2}}.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 107, 374, 127]]<|/det|>
Show that \((z_{1}z_{2})^{*} = z_{1}^{*}z_{2}^{*}.\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 107, 920, 126]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 138, 917, 504]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 510, 148, 528]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 508, 727, 529]]<|/det|>
\(z = 3\mathrm{e}^{\frac{1}{4}\pi \mathrm{i}}\) is a root of the equation \(z^{2} + bz + c = 0\) , where \(b\) and \(c\) are real.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 540, 596, 560]]<|/det|>
State the other root and hence find the values of \(b\) and \(c\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 541, 920, 560]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 75, 96, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 75, 448, 95]]<|/det|>
The equation of a curve is \(xy + y^2 \mathrm{e}^{-x} = 4.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 120, 148, 139]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 114, 361, 148]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = \frac{y^2 - ye^x}{xe^x + 2y}.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 121, 920, 140]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 153, 918, 653]]<|/det|>

<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 660, 618, 679]]<|/det|>
Find the gradients of the tangents to the curve when \(x = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[895, 660, 920, 679]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[280, 685, 918, 945]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 78, 94, 97]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 920, 122]]<|/det|>
Find the complex numbers \(z\) for which \(\frac{z + 4}{z + 4\mathrm{i}}\) is real and \(|z| = \sqrt{10}\) . Give your answers in the form \(z = x + \mathrm{i}y\) , where \(x\) and \(y\) are real.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 101, 920, 120]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 79, 94, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 584, 107]]<|/det|>
Let \(\mathrm{f}(x) = \frac{3a - 5x}{(3a + 2x)(2a - x)}\), where \(a\) is a positive constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 117, 917, 136]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 120, 144, 138]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 120, 410, 138]]<|/det|>
Express \(\mathrm{f}(x)\) in partial fractions.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 148, 917, 958]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 146, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 75, 918, 95]]<|/det|>
Hence obtain the expansion of \(\mathrm{f}(x)\) in ascending powers of \(x\), up to and including the term in \(x^2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 92, 918, 110]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 711, 703, 730]]<|/det|>
State the set of values of \(x\) for which the expansion in part **(b)** is valid.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 76, 144, 95]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 76, 564, 96]]<|/det|>
Prove the identity \(\cot^2 \theta - \tan^2 \theta \equiv 4 \cot 2\theta \cosec 2\theta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 76, 920, 96]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 75, 695, 94]]<|/det|>
Hence solve the equation \(\cot^2 x - \tan^2 x = 5\) sec \(2x\) for \(0^\circ < x < 90^\circ\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 75, 920, 94]]<|/det|>

<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 72, 753, 90]]<|/det|>
With respect to the origin \(O\) , the points \(A\) , \(B\) and \(C\) have position vectors given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[275, 100, 724, 120]]<|/det|>
\[\overrightarrow{OA} = \mathbf{i} + 2\mathbf{j},\quad \overrightarrow{OB} = \mathbf{i} + 3\mathbf{j} - 2\mathbf{k}\quad \mathrm{and}\quad \overrightarrow{OC} = 2\mathbf{i} - \mathbf{j} + 3\mathbf{k}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 134, 388, 151]]<|/det|>
The line \(l\) passes through \(B\) and \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 165, 148, 183]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 165, 377, 183]]<|/det|>
Find a vector equation for \(l\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 165, 920, 183]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 196, 917, 492]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 505, 148, 523]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 505, 590, 523]]<|/det|>
The point \(P\) is the foot of the perpendicular from \(A\) to \(l\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 537, 388, 555]]<|/det|>
Find the position vector of \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 537, 920, 555]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 567, 917, 925]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 106, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 72, 533, 90]]<|/det|>
The variables \(x\) and \(y\) satisfy the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[396, 96, 600, 125]]<|/det|>
\[\sin 4y\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} = x\sin 2y\sin 3x.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 133, 418, 152]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(y = \frac{1}{12}\pi\) when \(x = \frac{1}{2}\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 165, 144, 182]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 164, 688, 183]]<|/det|>
Solve the differential equation, obtaining a relation between \(x\) and \(y\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 165, 918, 183]]<|/det|>
<mark>[8]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 196, 917, 928]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 517, 144, 535]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 516, 601, 535]]<|/det|>
Given that \(0 < y < \frac{1}{2}\pi\), find the values of \(y\) when \(x = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 516, 920, 535]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 102, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[374, 87, 621, 225]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 252, 920, 287]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve \(y = \sqrt{x} \sin 2x\) for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant \frac{1}{2}\pi\). The curve has a maximum point at \(M\), where \(x = a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 301, 146, 319]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 301, 343, 319]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\tan 2a = -4a\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 301, 920, 319]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 330, 917, 715]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 734, 146, 752]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 733, 484, 752]]<|/det|>
Show by calculation that \(0.9 < a < 0.95\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 733, 920, 752]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 144, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 653, 90]]<|/det|>
Show that if a sequence of values given by the iterative formula

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[400, 98, 600, 125]]<|/det|>
\[x_{n + 1} = \frac{1}{2}\Big(\pi -\tan^{-1}\big(4x_n\big)\Big)\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[141, 133, 418, 151]]<|/det|>
converges, then it converges to \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 133, 920, 151]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 161, 917, 495]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 503, 148, 521]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 503, 920, 536]]<|/det|>
Use the iterative formula in part **(c)** to calculate \(a\) correct to 4 decimal places. Give the result of each iteration to 6 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 516, 920, 536]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]
